key_channel_insights.line_content: Approximately two-thirds of Qantas itineraries on OTA match website prices, reflecting stable parity and minimal average price gap.
MSE achieved 49.1% price parity last week with undercutting down to 14.4% and premium scenarios at only 10.8%.
GDS coverage expanded to 74.56% of routes with 70.42% of fares priced above Qantas.com and limited discounts at 3.46%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately two-thirds (67%) of Qantas itineraries on OTA mirror website prices, marking a 3.8% increase over the past month and negligible average price difference (0.01%).
Only about 3.2% of fares are higher on OTA, with an average premium of 0.19%, a slight uptick vs last month (+0.77%).
Roughly 3.2% of fares are cheaper on OTA, yielding an average 0.23% discount and a 1.2% frequency rise month-over-month.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Listings absent on OTA fell from 32.24% a month ago to 26.50% last week (–5.74%), indicating tighter OTA coverage.
‘Same’ fares rose to 67.13% last week (+0.40% vs prior week, +3.79% vs prior month) with virtually zero price gap (0.01%).
Higher fares on OTA account for 3.18% of itineraries, slightly below last week (–0.05%) but up from last month (+0.77%), with an average 0.19% markup.
Lower OTA fares also represent 3.18% of itineraries, down 0.11% vs prior week but up 1.18% vs prior month, averaging a 0.23% discount.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul listings match site prices 65.97% of the time, up 3.6% month-over-month; OTA higher fares occur in 2.85% of cases (0.15% markup) and lower fares in 3.48% (0.23% discount).
Long-haul parity sits at 76.72% (+5.0% vs month), with OTA higher fares at 5.94% (0.34% markup) and minimal lower-fare occurrences (0.71%, –0.12% discount).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Australian origin listings mirror site prices 67.32% of the time (+4.2% vs month); OTA markups appear in 2.49% (0.16% premium) and discounts in 2.78% (0.25% average discount).
Non-AU itineraries show parity in 62.16% (–5.2% vs month) but a high 20.95% incidence of OTA markups (0.28% premium) and 13.51% lower-fare frequency (0.08% discount).

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in travel, price parity is 66.09% (+3.7% vs month), with 3.40% of fares higher on OTA (0.20% premium) and 3.25% lower (0.23% discount).
Far-out bookings show even stronger parity at 69.33% (+4.0% vs month), OTA higher fares at 2.72% (0.15% premium), and lower fares at 3.04% (0.21% discount).

mse_highlights.line_content: Price parity on MSE reached 49.1% last week, marking a 4.4pp increase week-over-week and a 13.2pp rise month-over-month.
Instances where MSE undercut Qantas fell to 14.4% last week, down 2.7pp from the prior week and 12.7pp from last month, indicating improved competitiveness.
MSE higher-priced scenarios remain modest at 10.8% last week, with an average premium of 0.05%, underscoring minimal price inflation on the channel.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Last week 25.7% of routes had no Qantas offer on MSE, roughly stable week-over-week (–0.2pp) but down 5.7pp versus last month.
Nearly half (49.1%) of itineraries on MSE matched Qantas.com pricing last week, up 4.4pp WoW and 13.2pp MoM.
10.8% of fares on MSE were priced above Qantas.com last week, decreasing 1.5pp WoW but up 5.1pp versus last month; average premium held at 0.05%.
Only 14.4% of MSE fares undercut Qantas.com last week, down 2.7pp WoW and 12.7pp MoM, with an average discount of 0.13%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul parity climbed to 48.4% last week (up 4.8pp WoW), while undercutting fell to 13.6% (down 2.8pp).
Long-haul saw highest parity at 54.5% (up 0.9pp WoW) and undercuts at 20.9% (down 1.6pp), with MSE premiums averaging 0.23%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For AU markets, parity rose to 49.9% last week (+5.0pp WoW) as undercuts dipped to 12.8% (–3.0pp), and MSE premiums averaged 0.04%.
Non-AU origin routes experienced 53.7% undercutting last week (up 5.7pp) and only 27.5% parity (down 9.7pp), highlighting aggressive discounting abroad.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings held 48.3% parity last week (+3.6pp WoW) with undercuts at 15.2% (–1.9pp) and average MSE premiums of 0.06%.
Far-out bookings achieved 50.8% parity last week (+6.2pp WoW), undercuts declined to 12.7% (–4.2pp), and premiums averaged 0.04%.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS no-offer rate declined 5.69pp month-over-month to 25.44% in the latest week, indicating broader coverage vs Qantas.com.
Approximately 70% of itineraries on GDS carry a higher fare than the website, with a stable average premium of 0.10% week-over-week.
Just 3.46% of GDS listings undercut the website price, offering a modest average discount of 0.17%, up 2.47pp vs prior month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 25.44% of itineraries lacked a GDS offer last week, a 0.37pp decrease vs prior week and a 5.69pp improvement vs last month.
Only 0.68% of itineraries matched website fares on GDS, remaining flat both week-over-week (+0.02pp) and month-over-month (+0.32pp).
70.42% of itineraries were priced higher on GDS, up 0.41pp vs prior week and 2.90pp vs last month, with a 0.10% average fare premium.
3.46% of itineraries were cheaper on GDS, down 0.06pp week-over-week but up 2.47pp month-over-month, averaging a 0.17% discount.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw a 26.43% no-offer rate in the latest week (–5.64pp vs month) and 69.73% priced higher (+0.36pp wk/wk) at a 0.10% avg premium.
Long-haul itineraries had a lower 17.10% no-offer rate (–6.13pp vs month) and 76.01% priced higher (+0.70pp wk/wk) with a 0.10% avg premium.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic origins posted a 26.37% no-offer rate (–5.57pp vs month) and 70.24% of GDS fares higher (+0.46pp wk/wk) at a 0.10% avg premium.
International origins had near-full coverage with 1.34% no-offer and 74.50% priced higher, while 14.09% were lower on GDS, averaging a 0.05% discount.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings faced a 25.61% no-offer rate (–5.35pp vs month) and 70.10% priced higher (+0.82pp wk/wk) at a 0.10% avg premium.
Far-out bookings showed a 25.10% no-offer rate (–6.37pp vs month) and 71.14% priced higher (–0.32pp wk/wk), maintaining a 0.10% avg premium.
